rhq:bundle.name: ${rhq.cassandra.bundle.name}
rhq:bundle.description: A bundle for deploying RHQ Cassandra nodes.

rhq:input-property.name: cluster.name
rhq:input-property.description: The name of the cluster. This is used to prevent machines in one logical cluster from joining another

rhq:input-property.name: cluster.dir
rhq:input-property.description: The directory in which Cassandra nodes will be installed

rhq:input-property.name: data.dir
rhq:input-property.description: The directory where Cassandra should store data files.

rhq:input-property.name: commitlog.dir
rhq:input-property.description: The directory where Cassandra stores its commit logs.

rhq:input-property.name: saved.caches.dir
rhq:input-property.description: The directory where Cassandra stores saved caches.

rhq:input-property.name: log.dir
rhq:input-property.description: The directory where Cassandra stores log files.

rhq:input-property.name: logging.level
rhq:input-property.description: The log4j logging level to use.

rhq:input-property.name: seeds
rhq:input-property.description: A comma-delimited list of IP addresses/host names that are deemed contact points. Cassandra nodes use this list of hosts to find each other and learn the topology of the ring. If you are running a local development cluster, be sure to have aliases set up for localhost.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.num_tokens
rhq:input-property.description: Defines the number of tokens randomly assigned to a node on the ring. The more tokens, relative to other nodes, the larger the proportion of data that this node will store. You probably want all nodes to have the same number of tokens assuming they have equal hardware capability.

rhq:input-property.name: jmx.port
rhq:input-property.description: The port over which Cassandra listens for JMX connections. Each node should be assigned a unique port.

rhq:input-property.name: listen.address
rhq:input-property.description: Address used for inter-node communication. Defaults to value of hostname property.

rhq:input-property.name: rpc.address
rhq:input-property.description: Address used for Thrift RPC client communication. Defaults to value of hostname property.

rhq:input-property.name: cassandra.ring.delay
rhq:input-property.description: When a node initializes it contacts a seed and then sleeps for RING_DELAY (milliseconds) to learn about other nodes in the cluster. Cassandra uses a default value of 30 seconds.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.casandra.native_transport_max_threads
rhq:input-property.description: The maximum number of threads handling native CQL requests.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.native_transport_port
rhq:input-property.description: The port for the CQL native transport to listen for clients on.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.rpc_port
rhq:input-property.description: The port to listen for Thrift clients on.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.authenticator
rhq:input-property.description: A class that performs authentication. The value should be a fully qualified class name and implement IAuthenticator.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.authorizer
rhq:input-property.description: A class that performs authorization. Used to limit/provide permissions. The value should be a fully qualified class name and implement IAuthorizer.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.password.properties.file
rhq:input-property.description: The location of the password properties file used by SimpleAuthenticator. If a relative path is specified, its location is resolved relative to Cassandra's bin directory.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.access.properties.file
rhq:input-property.description: The location of the authorization properties file used by SimpleAuthority. If a relative path is specified, its location is resolved relative to Cassandra's bin directory.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.username
rhq:input-property.description: The username with which to authenticate requests to Cassandra.

rhq:input-property.name: rhq.cassandra.password
rhq:input-property.description: The password with which to authenticate requests to Cassandra.
